alert.note: Alert for Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 17 at 1:35AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM CDT/545 AM EDT/ EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Illinois and northwest Indiana, including the following counties, in east central Illinois, Iroquois. In northwest Indiana, Benton, Jasper and Newton. * WHEN...Until 445 AM CDT /545 AM EDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 134 AM CDT /234 AM EDT/, doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rensselaer, Watseka, Fowler, Kentland, Milford, Remington, Morocco, Sheldon, Goodland, Brook, Ashkum, Martinton, Earl Park, Stockland, Hanging Grove, Crescent City, Beaverville, Collegeville, Woodland and Donovan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
